# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Getting Started With VBO](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/getting-started)
- [Promoter Info / Promoter Profile](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/getting-started/how-to-add-or-edit-promoter-info-promoter-profile)

- Print

To edit your organization's profile,
go to SET UP > PROFILE > PROMOTER INFO.
Below is a walkthrough of this process with
some suggestions on completing the promoter
profile area.

**Change things like:**

Promoter Name

Time Zone

Currency

Primary Contacts (for VBO to contact)

Accounting Contact

Promoter Support Info

Default Login Pages

and more! **How to Edit Your Organization's Profile**

Go to **Setup** \> **Profile** \> **Promoter Info**.

At the top of the page, review and set the following:

- Currency and Local

- Confirm your **Time Zone** is accurate for your location.

- Fiscal Year

- Promoter Name

- Scroll down to enter your organization's **Mailing Address**.


![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12067483/image.png)

**Fill out the Primary Contact fields:**

- Contact 1, 2, and 3 are used for communication with VBO.


- Make sure **Contact 1** is the **main person** VBO should reach out to.


![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12067495/image.png)

**Locate the Accounting Contact section:**

- This is where invoices from VBO will be sent.

- If left blank, invoices will go to the **Primary Contact.**


![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12067534/image.png)

Next is the **Support Information** section:

- This info is shown on order confirmations and customer communications.

- Fill out your **Promoter Name**, **Telephone Number**, and **Email Address**.


![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12067541/image.png)

You may also enter an organizations **Tax ID (Tax No), Mobile Phone**, **Fax**, and your **Website.**

- Make sure the website is entered.


![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12067609/image.png)

Below that is the **Password Reset URL / Hold URL** section:

- This is **optional**

- Only fill this in if you are using the **My Account Plugin** on your website.

- If you're not using the plugin, you can skip this part.

- For more details about this topic, refer to this helpdoc: [My Account Plugin](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/embedding/my-account-page)


![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12067625/image.png)

Near the bottom, you'll see the **Description** area.

- This is optional.

- If filled out, it will appear at the top of your plugin.

- Leave blank if you prefer a cleaner look.


![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12067651/image.png)

- If the description is used, it will display on the top of your plugin as shown below.


![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12067678/image.png)

Enter your organizations name as the **Branded Domain**

- **Required**
- This is used for all the preview pages for VBO


![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12067745/image.png)

Last, set our default account page and the default box office page.

- Default Account Page - this is page you will be sent to right after sign in.

- Default Box Office Page - this page is your default boxoffice page. The first time you go to the box office tab for your current session, this page will be loaded.

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12067765/image.png)

Once finished, scroll to the bottom of the page and click **Save** to apply your changes.

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12067784/image.png)

- [Event status (public, private, offline, or canceled)](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/event-setup/how-to-change-an-event-status)

- Print

To change an events status - go to OPEN EVENTS and click the icons on the left hand side.

Private = Event is not listed online. Only accessible via unique event URL.

Public = Event is in public mode and is searchable online.

Offline = Event is not listed online and not sellable.

Canceled = Event is in a canceled state. It will show online but will show that the event is canceled status.

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Event Management](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/events)
- [Event Setup](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/event-setup)
- [Deleting Events](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/event-setup/how-to-delete-an-event)

- Print

To delete an event go to EVENTS > OPEN EVENTS or CLOSED EVENTS. Use the select action drop-down menu on the event that you want to delete and you'll see the delete option.

Only account admins can delete events. An event can only be deleted if there is no sale history or transactions. The drop-down menu will not have the delete option if a sale has occurred in the event or the user is not an admin.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/2715605/delete%20event%20crop.png)

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Event Management](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/events)
- [Event Setup](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/event-setup)
- [Add event dates](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/event-setup/how-to-add-event-dates)

- Print

This document will demo how to add more event dates to a live event. A video demo is below.

Go to EVENTS>OPEN EVENTS>from the select action menu on the event you'd like to add dates to, select MANAGE EVENT DATES. The page you will be presented with should look like this:

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/5952437/image.png)

From this page, you will be able to see the all the existing event dates. In the upper right corner of the screen, select ADD DATE. Input the event date / time, the venue info, and you can limit the ticket qty if applicable.

After a new date is added, select ![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/5952472/image.png) at the bottom of the slide-out menu. This will take you to the MANAGE TICKETS page. Here, you can apply your pricing template to the new dates by clicking the LOAD PRICING TEMPLATE button in the upper right corner of the screen.

Note: Don't forget to edit the ticket on sale times if you choose to copy the event date with the tickets attached. To learn how to edit the ticket sale times, use this help doc -  [Edit ticket sale times](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/ticketing-setup/how-to-edit-online-ticket-sale-times)

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Event Management](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/events)
- [Ticketing Setup](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/ticketing-setup)
- [Timed Ticketing Events](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/ticketing-setup/how-to-set-up-timed-ticketing-eventshow-to-set-up-timed-ticketing-events)

- Print

This help doc will demo how to set up timed ticketing events. Timed ticketing is used for events that have multiple entry times on the same day, and each time slot has its own inventory.

Examples - Haunted Houses, Museum Tours, or other timed attractions would use this feature.

Timed ticketing is for general admission events only **(assigned seating events would not use this feature)**.

In the example picture below, the patron would be getting 2 tickets for one of 3 available time slots. The time slots have their own inventory on the back end of VBO so each time slot can sell out if there is no more space in that time slot. **A setup video demo is on the bottom of this page.**

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/4587790/image.png)

**NOTE:** Event duration should be set on the secondary ticket (how long the tour is). This setting will update ALL time slot durations for that date. If the time slot duration is not set up on the secondary ticket, the system will default the tour duration to be 1 hour.

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/6084533/2021-08-12_15-28-21.png)

**Checking Guests In**

You can check guests in and view available inventory directly from the **MANAGE TICKETS** page on the event.

Click the timed ticket display in the top right.

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/6177382/2021-09-03_16-08-11.png)

From the timed ticket display, you can click on the qty number on a time slot to view the guest list and check users in by clicking the " **check in"** icon.

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/6177381/2021-09-03_15-54-52.png)

* * *

**Creating a Timed Ticket Report Using the Custom Sales Report**

The [Custom sales report](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/reports/custom-sales-report-overview) can be used to generate a timed ticket report. Follow these steps:

1. **Select Fields:** Choose the following fields for the report:



   - First Name

   - Last Name

   - Event Date

   - Order ID

   - Quantity (QTY)

   - Timed Ticket Info (this output column will show the time slot).
2. **Apply Filters:** In the filter section at the bottom of the report builder, select the specific event that has timed ticketing. Do not select filter by event date as this is already an output.

3. **Generate the Report:** Once the report is created, you can export it and then sort it in Excel.


Here is an example screenshot of what the report might look like.

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/11457077/image.png)

* * *

**Video Demo Of Timed Ticketing**

[Photo image of VBO Tickets](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdt5A_Oufk_m8sF28uy7Nyw?embeds_referring_euri=https%3A%2F%2Fvbotickets.helpdocsite.com%2F)

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Box Office](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/box-office)
- [Managing Orders](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/managing-orders)
- [Pending Sales / balance due / deposits](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/managing-orders/how-to-use-group-sales-and-messages-balance-due-orders)

- Print

This help doc will cover using the pending
balance feature. This feature allows promoters
to collect a deposit on the order and set the
remaining balance to be collected at a later
time. There are two videos below. Part 1 is the main video (watch that first), and part 2 will cover accepting online deposits for general admission events.

**Part 1 Video:**

\- Setting the default group sale messages

\- Creating a group sale

\- Finding the group sale in pending sales

\- Editing the sale (canceling, refunding,
etc...)

\- Paying the balance in the box office or
by sending a message to the customer

**Notes On Cancelling and Refunding Balance Due Orders**

- If a partial payment is made on an order **canceling** will refund the balance due (zero that out) and convert the amount paid into a cancellation fee.

- If a partial payment is made **refunding** will allow for a refund of the amount paid and refund the balance due (zero that out).

- If no payment has been made on the order - the only option is to refund, which will refund the balance due (zero out the order).


|
|

**Part 3 - Creating and sending payment warnings for overdue orders**

1. **Create a Warning Message Template**



   - Go to **CRM** tab.

   - Click on **Mail**, then select **Mail Templates**.

   - Click **Add Template**.

   - For the template type, choose **Payment Warning 1**. (You may also see options for Payment Warning 2 and 3.)

   - Enter a name for the template, such as “Warning Test”.

   - Type the warning message content you want to use.

   - Click **Add** to save the template.
2. **Locate the Transaction**



   - Navigate to the **Orders** tab.

   - Find and open the transaction related to the pending due order that's overdue.
3. **Send the Warning Message**



   - Click the gear on the order and click **Send Warning**.

   - From the dropdown, select the template you created (e.g., “Warning Test”).

   - The warning message will auto-fill from the template.

   - Click **Email** to send the message to the customer.

The customer will receive an email notifying them that their payment for the order is overdue and that they should contact the you to complete payment.

- [Box Office](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/box-office)
- [Selling Items](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/selling-items)
- [Using Holds](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/selling-items/how-to-set-up-and-use-holds)

- Print

This video will demo how to use the holds function in VBO Tickets. With the holds feature, you can place tickets on hold (which pulls inventory). Reminder emails can be sent to the user to complete their order online or in the box office. If a hold is set to expire, and the patron does not complete their order, tickets will be returned to inventory so tickets can be sold to another guest.

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Reports](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/reports)
- [Reports: Top 9 reports used in VBO Tickets](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/reports/top-9-reports-used-in-vbo-tickets)

- Print

Here are some of the most popular reports used in VBO:

- **Event Summary Report** \- this report gives you an overview of your event and includes info on sales for tickets, merchandise, donations, etc. To load this report, go to REPORTS > EVENT REPORTS and then select "open" or "closed" on the top of the screen. "Open" or "closed" is the status of your event - select "open" if the event date has not passed or select "closed" if the event date has passed.


- **Reconciliation Report** \- this report will help you reconcile credit card transactions processed through your payment gateway (Pay Pal, Authrize.net, Stripe, etc.). The report should be loaded on a day to day basis to check credit card transactions that were processed each day. To load this report, go to REPORTS > OTHER REPORTS and then select the reconciliation report from the report options. Related Helpdoc - [Reconcile credit card transactions with authorize.net](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/reports/how-to-reconcile-credit-card-transactions-with-authorize-net)


- **Custom Sales Report**\- The custom sales report allows for various searches and building your own reports. Once a report is built, you can run that same report again with a small change (like changing the date range). Reports are user specific - so each user can build their own reports. To load this report, go to REPORTS > CUSTOM SALES REPORT and then click "add report" to begin building your report. Related Video - [Custom sales report](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/reports/custom-sales-report-overview)


- **Custom Patron Repot** \- Similar to the custom sales report, but designed for a quick view of customer info like name, email, birthday, address, etc. To load this report, go to REPORTS > CUSTOM PATRON REPORT and then build your report by clicking "add report." Related Video - [Custom patron report](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/reports/how-to-use-the-custom-patron-report)


- **Will Call Report** \- Lists everyone coming to an event along with ticket info. The will call report has 3 views: standard, advanced, and lite. To load this report, go to BOX OFFICE and then select either Phone Sales or the Box Office tab and then select the "guest list." The will call report will be on the bottom of the guest list page.  Note: this report is also found in the reports area and can be selected from the open events date area. Related Video - [Will Report / Guest List](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/reports/how-to-use-the-will-call-list-report)


- **Cashier Report** \- Used for box office user drawer cash outs for day to day operations. To load this report, go to the Box Office tab and select "Cashier Report" on the bottom of the page.


* * *

Other Recommended Reports

- **Zip Code Report** \- Get an idea of who is coming to your events by zip code! This report shows the city, zip code, units sold, sales total, and percentage from a date range. This report is found in the "Other Reports" area.


- **Discounts Report** \- See discount code usage and sales. This report is found in the "Other Reports" area.


- **Global User Questions** \- Look at responses to checkout questions like "how did you hear about us?" This report is found in the "Other Reports" area. Related Help Doc - [Global User Questions](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/settings/how-to-set-up-global-user-questions-survey-questions)

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Getting Started With VBO](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/getting-started)
- [Promoter Logos](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/getting-started/how-to-update-promoter-logo)

- Print

To update your promoter logo, go to SET UP > PROFILE > PROMOTER LOGOS. Upload both a Profile Logo and a Report logo. Please upload the SAME photo for both the profile logo and the report logo.

**Profile Logo:**

Optimal Image size sizes: 300px wide by 300px tall.

[Download Profile logo template](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1J9iiP5lWj7mEI4S9LGPA6lMGP2FhM6mc/view?usp=sharing)

**Report Logo:**

Optimal Image size sizes: 170px wide by 100px tall.

[Download Report logo template](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hlwW4dg_KcMzUH3TdzOdeQuCfps-yJdO/view?usp=sharing)

**Best practice for using these logo templates:**

**﻿**

Open the template file in your image editor, and drop your logo in the center. Resize your logo until it fits nicely within the template dimensions. Then save as a transparent PNG file, and upload to your account.

_**\*\*\*It's recommended to upload your logo as a .png file with a transparent background to match the order confirmation.**_

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/4529310/image.png)

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Box Office](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/box-office)
- [Selling Items](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/selling-items)
- [Comp tickets](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/selling-items/how-to-sell-comp-tickets)

- Print

This help doc will demo how to sell comp tickets in the box office and add more comp tickets types if your organization requires them.

In the box office, select the number of seats or the seats you would like from a seat map you'd like and a menu below will appear. Under ticket name, you can open up a drop-down menu that looks like this:

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/5952555/image.png)

From this menu, you can select the ticket to be a "Comp Ticket" this will set the price to zero and waive all fees.

Custom comp tickets can also be set up using box office ticket types. [How to set up and use special box office only ticket types](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/settings/how-to-set-up-and-use-special-box-office-only-ticket-types)

If your event is free - simply set the price of the item to zero during set up.

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Event Management](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/events)
- [Registrations](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/registrations)
- [Registrations](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/registrations/how-to-set-up-a-registration-form-or-event)

- Print

The videos below will demo how to set up a registration form and attach it to a ticket. Start with Part 1 to learn the basics of setting up registration forms and attaching them to tickets. Part 2 will cover more advanced registration form setups.

Note: Fees on registrations can not be edited and will use the VBO registration fee. This fee can either be passed onto the patron or set to "promoter pays" and the promoter can absorb the fee.

**VIDEO**
**DEMOS**

**﻿**

**Part 1:** Building a basic registration form and attaching it to tickets. **[WATCH VIDEO](https://youtu.be/VsUSjEMGJnk)**

**Part 2 (optional):** Using conditional responses. **[WATCH VIDEO](https://youtu.be/5v_GdrBCNeY)**

* * *

**PROCESSING REGISTRATION IN THE BOX OFFICE** Registration forms can be filled out after the sale. You can press EDIT REGISTRATION on the box office confirmation screen and edit the form when it slides out.

![](https://s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/tw-desk/i/366030/attachment-inline/9e222b4d-92f8-4926-98a3-e1cb44b107f2.png)

**EDITING A FORM AFTER A SALE**

If the order has already been processed and you're returning later to edit the form, click to expand the order and you will see an edit option to edit the form answers.

![](https://s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/tw-desk/i/366030/attachment-inline/e313c688-d731-4fc8-a033-302bedc18b15.png)

* * *

**REGISTRATION REPORT:**

To access the registration report, go to REPORTS > EVENT REPORTS > REGISTRATION REPORT. At the top of the page, select either "open" or "closed" depending on the event status.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/5146966/image.png)

**ADDITIONAL SETTING (OPTIONAL): Registration Time Out**

By default, registration forms are set to 120 min. To adjust the length of time the cart will be open for a user to fill out the form, go to SET UP > REGISTRATIONS > REGISTRATION SETTINGS. Adjust the time "registration timeout" and press SAVE.

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/6975391/image.png)

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Subscriptions](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/subscriptions)
- [Types of VBO Subscriptions](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/subscriptions/types-of-subscriptions)

- Print

Below are the VBO subscription packages so you can think about which ones you might want to set up/offer for your organization.

**Subscription Types:**

**Flex Pass** \- Block of tickets (usually at a discounted price). The customer can use all the passes at once or use them for different shows.

[Flex Pass Set Up Demo](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/subscriptions/flex-pass-set-up-demo)

**Standard Subscription -** Customer buys a subscription, they get a subscription code, and then they use that code to make reservations online or at the box office.

[Standard Subscription Set Up Demo](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/subscriptions/standard-subscription-set-up-demo)

**Theatre Subscription -** Customer buys a subscription (either online or at the box office), the theatre then issues the tickets at a later time or directly after the sale.  In this package type, the box office (you) are responsible for assigning the seats (which gives you control of where you put guests on the seating chart).  The theatre subscription is for assigned seating venues.

[How to set up a theatre subscription and issue tickets](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/subscriptions/how-to-set-up-a-theatre-subscription-and-issue-tickets)

**Pick A Show -** Set a minimum number of shows required to get a % off tickets.  Example: SAVE 20% on tickets when you come to 3 or more shows in the season. The customer selects the shows, dates, and tickets all at once and then gets the discount on the final checkout page.

[Pick-A-Show by event subscription setup](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/subscriptions/pick-a-show-by-event-subscription-setup)

**Membership -** 1 month, 3 month, 6 month, or 1 year. membership. The customer buys a membership and can come every day or once per event (think museum membership or gym membership with this subscription type).

[How to set up a membership](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/subscriptions/how-to-set-up-a-membership)

**Patron Subscription** (also referred to as Online Theatre Subscription) - Promoter sets up specific dates that are included in the subscription. The customer then purchases the subscription and is issued tickets to those specific dates. If all events are assigned seating, the user would sit in the same seat for all events.

Example: A Friday night subscription might include tickets to shows 1, 2, and 3 on specific Friday night dates (date 1, date 2, and date 3) and sit is seat A, 14 for all 3 shows.

[Online/Patron Theatre Subscription Set Up Demo](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/subscriptions/online-patron-theatre-subscription-set-up-demo)

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Box Office](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/box-office)
- [Managing Orders](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/managing-orders)
- [How to refund an item](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/managing-orders/how-to-refund-an-item)

- Print

This guide walks you through how to issue a refund. It covers locating an order, selecting items to refund, applying optional fees, choosing refund destinations, and sending confirmation emails.

* * *

**How to Issue a Refund**

If you need to adjust the price of an item via an up or down exchange (rather than refunding), please refer to our [Exchange Tickets](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/managing-orders/how-to-exchange) helpdoc.

* * *

**When to Refund vs. Exchange**

- Use **refunds** when the customer is **not attending** the event and needs money returned.

- Use **exchanges** if the customer is **still attending**, but the order needs adjusting.


* * *

**Steps to Issue a Refund**

**1\.** Go to the **Box Office** section, then click on **Lookup, Exchanges, and Refunds**.

**2\. Locate the Order**

Search by **order number, customer name, or email**

Once the order appears, click the **gear icon** on the right and select **Refund Order**.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/11245416/image.png)

**3\. Select Items to Refund**

To issue a **full refund**, click the **top checkbox** to select all items.

To **partially refund**, select individual items as needed.

**4\. (Optional) Apply a Refund Fee**

Select Yes when asked "Do you want to charge a refund fee. This fee will be deducted from the total refunded to the customer.

**5\.** Click **Continue**

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12142536/image.png)

**6\. Choose Where to Refund To**

- Select where the refund should go.

- Usually this is the **original payment method** (such as credit card or cash).

- Other options may appear depending on the order.


**7\. (Optional) Add Notes and Confirmation Email** You may choose to send the customer **refund confirmation email or updated order confirmation.**

You can also add an **internal note** about the "reason for refund" area.

**8\. Finalize the Refund**

Review everything and click the **Refund** button to complete the process.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12142551/image.png)

* * *

Once you click **Refund**, the transaction is completed. That's it!

* * *

**Additional Info:** Sending a Refund Confirmation Email after an order is processed (Optional)

After the refund is complete:

**1.** Find the refunded order.

**2.** Click the **gear icon** next to the order.

**3.** Click **Refund Confirmation**.

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12142564/image.png)

**4.** A message editor will appear where you can:

- Edit the **message body**.

- Add or update **email addresses**. The customer’s email address will be pre-filled.

- Click **Send** when you're ready.


![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/3184854/blob)

* * *

**Example Refund Confirmation Email**![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/7698567/2022-08-29_11-29-38.png)

By default, the email includes basic refund details.

You can **customize** this message in the event settings.

To do this:

**1.** Go to **Set Up > Events > Event Settings**

2\. Click on Confirmation Text box.

**2.** In the slide out menu, scroll to the **Refund Message** section

**3.** Enter your custom message

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12142582/image.png)

Example Custom Refund Message Override:

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/7698644/2022-08-29_11-42-39.png)

metadata.title: How to refund an item - VBO Tickets Support

Select items for full or partial refund

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Box Office](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/box-office)
- [Managing Orders](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/managing-orders)
- [Viewing Refunded Items / Creating A Refund Report](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/managing-orders/how-to-view-refunded-items-and-run-a-refund-report)

- Print

This guide explains how to view refunded items on the **Orders page** and how to run a report showing **refunded transactions**.

* * *

**Viewing Refunded Items on the Orders Page**

1. Navigate to the **Orders** page.

2. On the right-hand side, check the box labeled **"Show Refunded Items."**

3. Once enabled, any order that includes a refund will be highlighted in **red.**

4. Click on a refunded order to load and view the refunded item(s) in the order details.







Note: The "Show Refunded Items" setting is also available directly on a patron's CRM profile when viewing their orders.


![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/8690194/image.png)

* * *

**Running a Report for Refunded Items**

1. Close out of the **Event Menu**, if open.

2. Go to the **Reports** section.

3. Select **Custom Sales Report**

4. If you're not familiar with using the Custom Sales Report, refer to this help doc: [Custom sales report](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/reports/custom-sales-report-overview).

5. Build a report with the output columns you'd like to see.

6. In the Output Columns area, locate and enable the **"Transaction Type"** output.



![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12142417/image.png)

7. Click **Save and Run**.


The report will now display a column indicating whether each transaction was a **Sale** or a **Refund**.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/12142438/image.png)

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Event Management](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/events)
- [Fees](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/fees)
- [VBO invoices and billing procedures](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/fees/where-to-find-vbo-invoices)

- Print

**Accessing VBO Invoices** VBO invoices can be accessed by navigating to REPORTS > ACCOUNTING > INVOICES. Use the dropdown at the top of the page to filter invoices by month.

**Billing Cycles**

- Billing cycles depend on your agreement. Promoters are typically either billed monthly or weekly.
- Weekly Billing: Monday 11:59 PM to Monday 11:59 PM (PST).

- Monthly Billing: First day of the month to the last day of the month.


**Invoice Delivery**

Invoices are sent to the accounting contact on file under SET UP > PROFILE > PROMOTER INFO. If no accounting contact is listed, invoices will be sent to the primary user’s email on the account.

* * *

**How VBO Fees Are Charged**

VBO fees are based on transactions processed within the billing cycle.

- **Order Changes Within the Same Billing Cycle**



  - If an order is refunded within the same billing cycle, no VBO fee is charged for that order.

  - If an exchange occurs within the same billing cycle, only one fee is applied.
- **Order Changes Outside the Billing Cycle**



  - Once a billing cycle closes, invoices do not change—fees are not refunded for orders refunded in later billing cycles.

  - Exchanges in a new billing cycle are treated as new transactions and incur a new fee, except for subscriber ticket exchanges.

  - Example: An order processed in March and exchanged in April will incur a new fee in April unless it’s a subscriber ticket.

* * *

**Max Comp Allocation Fee**

If applicable, the comp max overage is calculated on the first invoice of each month, based on comps issued in the previous month.

**How It’s Calculated**

1. Total items sold (excluding subscription/member tickets) x max comp % = comp allocation

2. Comp allocation - total comped items issued = under/overage

3. Overage comps are charged the regular box office fee on the next invoice.


**Example**

- A promoter has a 5% max comp cap.

- They sell 100 items in a month.

- Of those, 10 items are comps.


→ They are allowed 5 free comps, but the remaining 5 comps exceed the cap and will be charged the regular box office fee on the next invoice.

**Questions About Fees?**

Should you have additional questions about your service fees, please contact your account representative.

- Print

This helpdoc will cover:

\- Editing the mail cut off time setting.

\- Setting up mail fees in the global settings

\- Enabling mail delivery on a per event level

\- How to manage and fulfill orders that need to be mailed

**Mail Cut-Off Time Setting**

Under **Setup > Events > Delivery Settings**, you’ll find the **Mail Cut-Off Time** setting. This allows promoters to specify how many days before an events **start time** mail delivery should be disabled for online sales. Note that mail delivery will still be available for box office sales.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/11185123/image.png)

By default, the **Mail Cut-Off Time** is set to 7 days prior to the event, but promoters can adjust this setting anywhere from 0 to 60 days, based on their requirements.

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Box Office](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/box-office)
- [Managing Orders](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/managing-orders)
- [Exchange Tickets](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/managing-orders/how-to-exchange)

- Print

This tutorial will demo how to exchange tickets.

Exchanges are used when the patron is still coming to the event, but the order needs to be adjusted.

Exchanges should not be used if you are simply trying to refund an item from the patron's order. If you are looking for info on how to refund an item, refer to this help doc: [How to refund an item](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/box-office/how-to-refund-an-item).

* * *

There are two types of exchanges: **straight exchange** or an **up/down exchange.**

**Straight Exchange** = Exchanging tickets for other tickets. For example, the patron purchased tickets to Friday and wants to exchange the tickets to Saturday.

_\\*\\* In this exchange type, the total will equal the amount paid by the patron in the original order (there will be $0.00 due at the end of the order)._

**Up / Down Exchange** = Exchanging tickets to higher or lower-priced tickets. This exchange type will result in a recalculation of the order and the patron will either be refunded the difference or will have a balance due. If the order amount results in a refund, options will appear and you can select where to refund the money (example: refund to donation).

_\\*\\* NOTE: Some payment gateways (for example authorize.net) do not support same-day partial refunds. If your gateway does not support same-day partial refunds, you will need to either wait 24 hours and then do a partial refund, or you will need to cancel the order and reprocess._

* * *

**There are two videos below**

**1\. How To Process A Straight Exchange:**

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Event Management](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/events)
- [Discounts](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/discounts)
- [Discount Codes](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/discounts/how-to-set-up-discount-codes)

- Print

Discount codes can either be
global (all events), event-specific, event category-specific, event
date/ticket or section-specific.
This help doc covers both types of
discount code setups in two
different videos.

Here are types of the discount options available:

Buy X tickets get X tickets free

Free Ticket

% or $ off per ticket

% or $ off per order

Fixed Ticket Price

There is also an option to set a minimum cart value required to qualify for a discount

Part 1 will cover
how to set up a global or
event-specific discount code.

Part 2 will cover how to set up an event category-specific discount code.

Part 3 will cover how to set up
a date-specific or ticket-specific
discount code.

When setting up discount codes, only use letters and numbers, and do not add spaces or special characters.

Example: FUNDAY2021

* * *

**Discount Code Settings:**

**﻿**

**Limit Per Order:** the number of tickets that can be discounted per order (per transaction).

**﻿**

Example: 2 tickets per transaction.

**﻿**

**Limit Total:** the total number of tickets that can be discounted using the code - **EVER**

**﻿**

Example:limit 100. This would mean 100 total tickets can be discounted using the code. Once someone tries to buy ticket 101 the code would no longer work.

* * *

**How to do FREE Items:** Do not do 100% OFF

Instead, select **FREE TICKET**

**﻿**

Example:

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/9280884/image.png)

* * *

**Part 1: how to set up a**
**global or event-specific**
**discount**
**code.**

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Getting Started With VBO](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/getting-started)
- [Creating New Users / Setting Permissions](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/getting-started/how-to-create-new-users)

- Print

This helpdoc explains how to add new users, assign user types, and configure permissions. It covers **Standard Users** for internal staff with a helpdoc link to **Event Manager Users** for limited access by external users, like event renters.

**How to Add a New User**

1. **Navigate to User Setup:** Go to **SET UP > MORE > USERS**.

2. **Add a New User:**



   - Click the green **Add User** button on the top-right corner of the page.



     ![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/8387296/image.png)

   - Fill in the user's information:



     - Name

     - Email

     - Username
   - For **User Type**, leave it as **Standard User** (default):





     - **Standard Users**: The primary user type for your organization (e.g., box office staff, managers, accountants, etc.)

     - **Event Manager Profiles**: Designed for external users (e.g., event renters) with limited access. [Learn More about Event Manager Profiles](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/other-questions/how-to-set-up-and-use-event-manager-profiles).
   - Once the information is entered, click the green **ADD USER** button at the bottom of the screen.





     The user will receive an email to create a password and sign in.











     Note - the user needs to set their password as soon as possible as the password reset link will expire if no action is taken.











     ![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/8387312/image.png)
3. **Set User Permissions:**



   - After creating the user, click the green **Permissions** button next to their name. You can complete this step even before the user accepts the password reset email.

   - ![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/8387437/image.png)

   - If the user should be an **Admin**:





     - Check the **Admin** checkbox at the top of the permissions page.

     - Admin accounts have access to the main dashboard.
   - Assign specific permissions by selecting navigation tabs:



     - For example, enabling **EVENTS** grants access to that navigation tab.

     - Further refine access by deselecting checkboxes for restricted various elements within a section.
   - Click **SAVE** to finalize the permissions.

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [Event Management](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/events)
- [Event Setup](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/event-setup)
- [Seat Selection View: (seat map view, list view, or mixed seating view)](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/event-setup/how-to-change-the-seat-selection-view)

- Print

The two most common seat selection views are List View and Seat Map View. List View is for general admission events and lists all the tickets out in a list display.  Seat Map View will show the seat map first if your event uses a seating chart. Mixed view is for events that use a general admission template and an assigned seating template.

To change an event to either Seat Map View, List View, or Mixed Seating:

- Go to OPEN EVENTS and select "edit event info" from the drop down menu.


![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20180515192041969.126481.20180515192041969JtMKC.png)

- On the edit event info page, select the desired view and press **SAVE** when you're done.


![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20180515191221548.126481.20180515191221548g10np.png)

# [Knowledge Base](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/)

- [VBO Event Manager App](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/vbo-mobile-app)
- [Mobile Event Manager 2.0 App](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/vbo-mobile-app/how-to-use-the-vbo-mobile-app)

- Print

The **Mobile Event Manager** **2.0** app is
an application for event hosts,
managers, or promoters to help manage
events remotely from their devices
with several functions available to
their use. Below you'll find a video that gives a quick overview of the app as well as step-by-step instructions for some of the functions.

Make sure you are connected
to a network before
login.

﻿

NOTE: In order to scan, the event date must be today or in the future. The app will not show events in the past.

﻿

NOTE: the app is not available on the Amazon App Store. Do not purchase devices that do not support Apple IOS or Android stores.

﻿

NOTE: Please download and use the **Mobile Event Manager** **2.0** app. This is the latest app available.

﻿

![Image Placeholder](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/10738791/image.png)

Mobile Event Manager App Overview - YouTube

[Photo image of VBO Tickets](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdt5A_Oufk_m8sF28uy7Nyw?embeds_referring_euri=https%3A%2F%2Fvbotickets.helpdocsite.com%2F)

**How to activate your event to begin**
**processing:**

1\. Select the menu icon in the top
left.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/732304/1IMG_68521-577x1024.png)

2\. Locate and press the events button, the
events page should appear.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/732307/2IMG_6875-577x1024.png)

3\. Select an event and a green indicator will
show on the left.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/732308/3IMG_68551-577x1024.png)

4\. You can also press the pin symbol to
bookmark events so that it can be easily
accessed directly once you login in the
future.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/732317/5IMG_7039-577x1024.png)

**To view event stats once logged**
**in:**

1\. Select the menu icon in the top left, a
menu will appear.

2\. Locate and press the Stats button, the
stats page should appear.

3\. View basic stats regarding your event, the
quantity of tickets sold, orders, and total
sales. A graph is also present to visualize of
sales progress.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/732318/6IMG_6856-577x1024.png)

4: If you select seat map, you will be able to
see the seating arrangement.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/732319/7IMG_6857-577x1024.png)

**How to use lookup feature once logged**
**in:**

1\. Select the menu icon in the top left,
a menu will appear.

2\. Select events and choose the event and
event date.

3\. Select the menu button again
and click on Lookup, a full list
should appear (if list is 500
guests and under). If over 500
guests, the list may appear blank
but is not, continue your search.
(Be sure you have already set the
device to the event date so that
the guest list is synced).

4\. Use the search bar to enter a guest’s name
or order number. (You may also check guests in
and out with the lookup feature)

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/732321/8IMG_6859-577x1024.png)![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/732322/9IMG_6860-577x1024.png)

**How to setup scanner once logged**
**in:**

1\. Select the menu icon in the top left, a menu
will appear.

2\. Locate and press the setup button, the setup
page should appear.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/732335/10IMG_6853-577x1024.png)

3: Scroll to scanner setup, slide offline
scanner switch to the right to turn on. The
button will turn green to indicate it has been
switched on.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/732336/11IMG_6862-577x1024.png)

**How to enable DT (Laser) scanner (for lenea**
**pro only), once logged in:**

1\. Select the menu icon in the top
left, a menu will appear.

2\. Locate and press the setup button, the setup
page should appear.

3\. Scroll down to DT Device Scanner and swipe
button to the right to enable. The button will
turn green to indicate it has been switched
on.

![](https://vbotickets.helpdocsite.com/desk/file/732337/12IMG_6862-577x1024.png)

**How to enable DT Swiper (Credit card**
**swiper), once logged in:**

1\. Select the menu icon in the top left,
a menu will appear.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328180516868.126481.20170328180516868Wsl2R.png)

2\. Locate and press the setup button, the setup
page should appear.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328180636370.126481.20170328180636370j2Gh3.png)

3\. Scroll down to DT swiper and swipe to
the right to enable. The button will turn
green to indicate it has been switched
on.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328180708851.126481.20170328180708851tMdV2.png)

**How to scan tickets using DT (laser)**
**scanning (for lenea pro only), once**
**logged in:**

1: Select the menu icon in the top left,
a menu will appear.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328180816964.126481.20170328180816964JXuMn.png)

2: Locate and press the scan button, the scan
page should appear.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328180857871.126481.20170328180857871z3UI3.png)

3: If you’re using the DT (laser) scanner, an
image should appear on the screen of the
device in use. Two buttons below indicate the
type of scanning beginning with check-in
highlighted in green that you will be scanning
guests into a event. If you’re scanning a
group of the same order, select group scan
located next to the check in button to scan
one ticket, which will check in the whole
party. To check out guests, press the check in
button and it will switch to check out
highlighted in blue.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328180946136.126481.20170328180946136ji87B.png)

4: Once ticket is scanned, green will
indicate valid tickets red will indicate
invalid tickets or duplicates. Request that
guests present the original ticket printed to
avoid complications of duplicate
tickets.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328181131898.126481.201703281811318988xmNo.png)![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328181119942.126481.20170328181119942SRcvl.png)![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328181101606.126481.20170328181101606KsBX5.png)![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328181048780.126481.20170328181048780irtdv.png)_TIP:_
_We suggest to only use laser when in poor_
_or dark lighting to conserve battery life,_
_camera scanning in well lighted settings_
_will function to your scanning needs_
_without compromising battery life._

**How to scan tickets using image scanning,**
**once logged in:**

1\. Select the menu icon in the top left,
a menu will appear.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328181913245.126481.20170328181913245b6J84.png)

2: Locate and press the scan button, the scan
page should appear.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328182002890.126481.20170328182002890TPyQc.png)

3: With normal image scanning, the camera
sight will appear. Place camera view over
ticket to scan the ticket. Two buttons below
indicate the type of scanning beginning with
check-in highlighted in green that you will be
scanning guests into a event. If you’re
scanning a group of the same order, select
group scan located next to the check in button
to scan one ticket, which will check in the
whole party. To check out guests, press the
check in button and it will switch to check
out highlighted in blue.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328182117858.126481.20170328182117858RIZs1.png)

4: Once ticket is scanned, green will
indicate valid tickets red will indicate
invalid tickets or duplicates. Request
that guests present the original ticket
printed to avoid complications of
duplicate tickets.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328182324273.126481.201703281823242731Ylel.png)![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328182352135.126481.201703281823521354FLm9.png)![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328182419450.126481.20170328182419450OEgxX.png)![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328182456850.126481.20170328182456850g1ih0.png)![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328182532375.126481.20170328182532375ofX6h.png)**How**
**to setup Star Micronics Wireless Bluetooth**
**Printer:**

1: Enter your devices settings.

2: Open the Bluetooth function.

3: Search for other devices.

4: Connect to Star Micronics

5: Now you may print receipts from
checkout.

Note: Depending whether you are using an
Android or iOS device, There may be extra
steps needed to connect, which apply when
you’re unable to find the Star Micronics when
attempting to connect. Please do the following
if you are experiencing this, item A will
explain for Android users and item B for iOS
users.

A: If Star Micronics device is not set on
Bluetooth Mode, begin with holding the mode
button for 10sec. Then the screen will appear
blue with the current mode highlight. Press
mode button again to go through the modes,
stop once you have found “Bluetooth Mode” and
then hold both “Bluetooth” and “Feed” button
for 10sec and let go. This should complete the
mode switching and will print a receipt with
specs.

B: If Star Micronics device is not set on
Bluetooth iAP, begin with holding the mode
button for 10sec. Then the screen will appear
blue with the current mode highlight. Press
mode button again to go through the modes,
stop once you have found “Bluetooth iAP” and
then hold both “Bluetooth” and “Feed” button
for 10sec and let go. This should complete the
mode switching and will print a receipt with
specs.

**![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328182833181.126481.20170328182833181YWaDd.png)![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328182905783.126481.20170328182905783n0QXS.png)**

**Selling once logged in:**

1: Select the menu icon in the top left, a
menu will appear.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328183450659.126481.20170328183450659ejGMe.png)

2: Locate and press the sell button, the sell
page should appear.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328183519422.126481.20170328183519422eJxpI.png)

3: You will find the title “Tickets”
highlighted in green along side the ticket
types for purchase. The plus sign indicates
for the addiction of tickets and minus sign
for the subtraction of tickets. The total
amount of sales will automatically calculate
until the check out basket is complete.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328183549708.126481.20170328183549708XFKQx.png)

4: For check out you will be presented with two
options; **A) Cash** and **B)**
**Credit**.

**A:** Once cash is selected, you will be
shown to the next page where you may enter
sales details. Once you complete the order,
you will have the option to email, save, and
print receipts. To print receipts please be
sure that you are connected to the wireless
printer, via Bluetooth. (Refer to how to setup
Star Micronics Wireless Bluetooth
Printer)

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328183622942.126481.20170328183622942GmgMw.png)![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328183658870.126481.20170328183658870b3Y6M.png)

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328183732137.126481.20170328183732137Ks3bG.png)

**B:** For credit card processing - a pin and chip card unit is requried. Reach out to [onbaording@vbotickets.com](mailto:onbaording@vbotickets.com) for more info on pin and chip devices.

5: **Merchandise**; when adding merchandise
items, select the tickets button highlighted
in green and a drop down menu will appear with
more options and select merchandise, and add
items desired to cart.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328183936059.126481.201703281839360595GTLx.png)![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328184000907.126481.20170328184000907lBkpm.png)

6: **Donations**; When adding donations,
select the tickets button highlighted in green
and a drop down menu will appear with more
options and select donations, on the following
page you may enter the donation amount, select
the Champaign in which you want to enter the
contribution to and the type of donation, then
add to cart.

![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328184254814.126481.20170328184254814tfFtN.png)![](https://tw-desk-files.teamwork.com/i/366030/attachment-inline/126481.20170328184318243.126481.20170328184318243cOuue.png)
